@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} invested in an arcane device are lost to the inventor until they’re used or recovered with Tinkering, see below (they don’t recharge).

Power Modifiers: A user may spend a device’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} as desired, including enabling any applicable @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers}.

Arcane devices may not be @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05activation0000]{Shorted}.

Limitations: Arcane devices may benefit from @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Limitations}.

Activation: The creator uses his arcane skill as usual. Others use whatever skill is associated with the device’s form—guns use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting}, grenades use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing), and so on. If there is no other obvious skill, such as for a potion or worn item, the character rolls the inventor’s arcane skill as if it were his own (he does not benefit from any of the creator’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Edges} or other abilities, however).

Failure to activate the device costs one @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Point} as usual, and a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Critical Failure} causes the user @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Fatigue}.

Tinkering: A creator can reassign up to five @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} per action between an arcane device and her own pool. She must be in physical contact with the item to do so. Inventors should lend out their devices very carefully!

Example: Gabe is an alchemist. He makes an “oil of sharpness” Red can rub on her sword to activate the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Smite]{smite} power. He invests four @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} into it. Red soon finds herself in battle with the undead. She rubs the oil on the blade and rolls Gabe’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr05]{Weird Science} (since there’s no other obvious skill). She fails, which drains the oil of one Power Point. She tries again in the next round and gets a raise, granting her sword +4 damage. Smite normally costs 2 Power Points but Gabe’s Trapping has the “@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03touchattack000]{Touch}” Limitation so it only costs 1 point each time she applies it (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trappings}).

Arcane Device Examples

Dr. Destruction makes an invisibility belt and gives it to one of his minions. He has 20 @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} and puts 5 of them into the belt, reducing his remaining pool to 15.

When the minion wants to turn invisible, he rolls Dr. Destruction’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr05]{Weird Science} skill. This costs 1 less Power Point than usual because of the belt’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Limitation}—it must be worn to activate so it has a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03touchattack000]{Touch}.

Dr. Destruction also gives the minion the bolt power in the form of a ray gun and invests it with 10 Power Points. The minion rolls @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} to fire it.

The minion suffers @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Fatigue} if he rolls a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Critical Failure} activating either device.

Once the belt or gun is out of energy, Dr. Destruction can recover the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} he invested in it normally (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05activation0000]{Recharging}).

Power Modifiers.name: Power Modifiers
Power Modifiers.text:
Power Modifiers

Power Modifiers allow characters to customize their abilities, adding a special effect that better reflects her @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{power's} @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}.

Power Modifiers are selected each time a power is activated and may be freely changed each time. An icy @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Bolt]{bolt} might cause @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armorpiercin00]{Armor Piercing} damage in one attack and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05lingeringdam00]{Lingering Damage} in the next.

A number of common modifiers are listed below, and some powers have additional options as well. The number in parentheses is the price in additional @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} it costs to add the effect.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Casters} must declare which modifiers they’re using before rolling their arcane skill.

Unless a modifier says otherwise, it may be applied to any power, but only once per casting.

Power Modifiers last for the Duration of the spell, or until the end of the target’s next turn in the case of Instant powers.

Powers.name: Powers
Powers.text:
Powers

Most Savage Worlds settings feature “magic” in one form or another. Whether it’s hidden occult lore practiced only by dark cultists, voodoo rituals, the eldritch sorcery of powerful wizards, weird gadgets created by mad scientists, super powers, or brain-burning psionics, these rules handle it all in one simple system.

For ease of use, we call all of these effects “powers.” They work the same from game to game, but the particular use, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{modifiers} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trappings} give the same core powers endless variations.

List of Powers

Listed below are a number of powers available in most Savage Settings. Each power has the following statistics:

Rank: The @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Rank} a character must be to learn the power.

Power Points: The cost to activate the power in @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}.

Range: The maximum distance between the caster and the power’s effect. Range is often expressed as @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts}  or some multiple thereof. If so, read @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} as inches on the tabletop (twice that in yards). A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} of d10, for example, means the power can be cast up to 10″ (20 yards) away.

Unless the power says otherwise, Range has no effect after the power is activated. An ally who has been granted @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility}, for example, may then move beyond the caster’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts}  with no ill effect.

Duration: How long the power lasts in @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{rounds} (unless otherwise noted).

Powers expire at the end of the character’s turn X @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{rounds} later, where X is the Duration listed. Count the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{rounds} the power activated. If a psychic activates @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{boost Trait} (Duration 5) on the second @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{rounds} of combat, for example, it remains in place until the end of her turn on the sixth @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{rounds}

Powers may be maintained for their base Duration for 1 @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Point} per individual.

Unless it says otherwise, the caster can ter­minate a power she’s activated as a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03actions0000000]{free action}. She must terminate the entire power—she can’t leave it on for some and off for others.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trappings} : These are descriptive ideas and suggestions for how the power might look or manifest in different types of settings.

Naming Powers

Players are encouraged to note their powers’ Trappings and what the character might call them. A druid in a typical fantasy setting might write down his spells like this, for example:

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Bolt]{Bolt} (Splinters—shards of wood)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost/Lower Trait} (Blessing/Curse of Gaia —slight healthy or sickly green glow)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Entangle]{Entangle} (Entangle—grasping vines rise from the earth)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Protection]{Protection} (Bark skin—skin turns vaguely bark-like)

A mad scientist in the world of Deadlands: The Weird West might record the exact same powers like this:

  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Bolt]{Bolt} (Acid gun)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost/Lower Trait} (Dr. Worthington’s Patented Pep Pills)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Entangle]{Entangle} (Dr. Worthington’s Fast-Drying Resin)
  • @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Protection]{Protection} (Electrostatic clothing)

Trappings.name: Trappings
Trappings.text:
Trappings

Trappings allow the core @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers} presented in this chapter to have many different appearances. They usually have no game effect on their own, but are important for atmosphere and theme.

One character might fire a swarm of bees to attack her foes, for example, while another shoots red lasers from her eyes. Both are examples of the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Bolt]{bolt} power and share the same mechanics, but they look and are described differently.

Trappings do matter when an obstacle or opponent has a particular strength or weakness. If an ice troll suffers +4 damage from fire- or heat-based attacks, for example, a blast a player describes as a fireball counts as a fire attack and does +4 damage.

Once described, a power’s Trappings don’t change without the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Wizard]{Wizard} Edge, or an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Advance}—see below.

A character can alter the power’s effects as she wishes using the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers}.

Synergy

Sometimes logic dictates a power’s Trapping should have some additional effect. Zapping someone with a lightning bolt while they’re standing in water should cause additional @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02damage00000000]{damage}, for example, or less if they’re wearing a rubber hazmat suit.

When this occurs, the GM can decide there’s synergy that either increases or decreases the effect or damage (GM’s call) by +2 or −2.

Oppositional forces, such as fire and ice or light and darkness, don’t have synergy against one another (though such effects are sometimes accounted for in some creatures’ @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06bestiary000000]{Special Abilities}). If a fire @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Blast]{blast} hits ice armor (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Protection]{Protection}), for example, there’s no synergy because they cancel each other out.

Limitations

Sometimes a power’s Trapping imposes a limitation on the power. This gives the power focus at the expense of versatility, reducing the strain it causes the caster.

The Limitation is permanent and always in effect unless changed with an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Advance} as noted below.

Each limitation placed upon the power reduces its total @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Point} cost by one (to a minimum of 1). If this would reduce the cost to 0, you gain a +1 bonus (+2 maximum) to the arcane skill total instead.

  • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{RANGE}: The power’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} is reduced to Touch (and its listed @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} is greater).
  • PERSONAL: The power's @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} becomes Self (and has a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} of Touch or the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} Limitation above).
  • ASPECT: The character can only access one aspect of a power (that has more than one choice), such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Sloth/Speed]{sloth/speed} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{boost/lower Trait}.

Adding & Changing Trappings

A character gets two new @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers} when he takes the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.New Powers]{New Powers} Edge. He may instead add Trappings to his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers} in place of one or two of the new @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers}. A hero who takes the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.New Powers]{New Powers} Edge, for example, could choose one new power and add an ice Trapping to her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Bolt]{olt}.

The GM may also allow a player to change the trapping of existing power when she gains an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Advance}. This should reflect a major change in the character in some way as determined by the player and GM.

More on Trappings

Trappings allow an endless variety of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers} and the sources of those @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers}. Sometimes that might produce some st@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} results, so the player and GM must use common sense to figure out any inconsistencies. Here’s an example.

Gabe is an alchemist in a fantasy game. He decides his blast power manifests as a bag of small, explosive pots he hurls like grenades.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Blast]{blast} has a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} ×2. With a d8 @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts}, that’s 16″ with no @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} penalties. This is sometimes better than using Athletics to throw an actual grenade, which has @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} penalties at 10″ and 20.” That’s okay—Gabe’s player has to track and use @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}. Another character with traditional grenades doesn’t, but must contend with @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} modifiers.

Arcane Background (Gifted).name: Arcane Background (Gifted)
Arcane Background (Gifted).text:
Arcane Background (Gifted)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Focus]{Focus} (@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Spirit})
  • STARTING POWERS: 1
  • POWER POINTS: 15

The character has innate abilities that don’t fit into the usual tropes of magic, miracles, or psionics. Their powers may be low-level super powers, divine gifts, or even alien abilities, and are often very unusual or unique for their setting.

Arcane Background (Magic).name: Arcane Background (Magic)
Arcane Background (Magic).text:
Arcane Background (Magic)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Spellcasting]{Spellcasting} (@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts})
  • STARTING POWERS: 3
  • POWER POINTS: 10

Magicians range from powerful wizards to vile cultists. They draw on raw supernatural energy to fuel their eldritch fires. This energy infuses the worlds in which they live, and is drawn forth with gestures, words of power, or ancient runes.

Arcane Background (Miracles).name: Arcane Background (Miracles)
Arcane Background (Miracles).text:
Arcane Background (Miracles)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Faith]{Faith} (@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Spirit})
  • STARTING POWERS: 3
  • POWER POINTS: 10

Those who invoke miracles draw their power from a divine presence of some sort, including gods, nature, or spirits. Their powers are usually invoked with a few words of prayer or by performing established rituals.

Those who cast miracles are champions of their particular religions. They typically have @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01hindrances0000]{Hindrances} that pertain to their service, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.Vow]{Vow} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.Obligation]{Obligation}. They might also have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Connections]{Connections} to others of their religion who can help them out when their divine energies wane.

Arcane Background (Psionics).name: Arcane Background (Psionics)
Arcane Background (Psionics).text:
Arcane Background (Psionics)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Psionics]{Psionics} (@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts})
  • STARTING POWERS: 3
  • POWER POINTS: 10

Psionicists tap into their own mental energy to manipulate matter, read minds, and far more. Some are agents in the employ of a vast government agency, while others are often on the run from them! Some may have years of training or they might have developed their incredible powers in isolation.

Arcane Background (Weird Science).name: Arcane Background (Weird Science)
Arcane Background (Weird Science).text:
Arcane Background (Weird Science)

  • ARCANE SKILL: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Arcane Background (Weird Science)]{Weird Science} (@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts})
  • STARTING POWERS: 2
  • POWER POINTS: 15

Weird scientists use strange and powerful inventions beyond the normal technological level of the setting. Such creations might be possible due to super fuels, alien discoveries, or the raw intellect of rare super-geniuses who push the boundaries of science.

A weird scientist’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trappings} must always include the item they’re associated with. The burst power might manifest through a magical flame­thrower in Deadlands: The Weird West, for instance, while “Dr. Gabriel’s Wondrous Restorative Elixir!” is a healing potion.

Weird scientists must have their devices at hand to activate their powers (but see Jury Rig, below).

Other characters can’t activate the inventor’s creations. They might not understand the strange mechanisms required to make it work, the device might not be “calibrated” or portioned for other users, or it might just “fritz out” for anyone but the creator. While this may seem a bit strange narratively, the “magic”—and the Power Points—come from the inventor so he must be the one to activate it

Creating devices for others is possible—it just requires an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanedevice00]{Arcane Device} and the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Artificer]{Artificer} Edge.

The inventor can use his devices on others, of course, including administering drinks from his magical elixirs or giving them injections of some miraculous super serum he’s created. If Dr. Gabriel administers his elixir, for example, he rolls to activate the power normally. If he gives someone the bottle to use later, they’ll find it’s lost its potency.

Jury Rig: Weird scientists must usually activate their powers through their assigned device, but they can improvise other ways if needed at a −2 penalty. This requires a decent rationale relative to the setting and the GM’s permission.

Example: Gabe is captured by evil aliens and all his equipment is taken. He’s placed in a holding cell and decides he’ll use the overhead lights and whatever the aliens use for electricity to create a makeshift blast. The GM agrees this will work, but only once since it will destroy the lights and short out the cell’s energy in the process.

Armor Piercing (+1 to +3).name: Armor Piercing (+1 to +3)
Armor Piercing (+1 to +3).text:
Armor Piercing (+1 to +3)

The attack is focused to defeat armor or seeks out a foe’s exposed areas. Each @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Point} spent grants the power @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armorpiercin00]{AP 2}, to a max­imum of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armorpiercin00]{AP 6}.

Fatigue (+2).name: Fatigue (+2)
Fatigue (+2).text:
Fatigue (+2)

Powers that drain or tax an opponent can cause @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Fatigue}. This modifier may be attached to any @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{power} that can cause damage or is resisted by the target. If she’s affected by the power in any way, she also suffers Fatigue. This cannot cause @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Incapacitation}, however.

Glow or Shroud (+1).name: Glow or Shroud (+1)
Glow or Shroud (+1).text:
Glow/Shroud (+1)

Glow gives off soft light of an appro­priate color for its @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping} (or caster’s choice). This creates soft light in a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor07gamema.JournalEntryPage.07gamemasterin00]{Small Blast Template} centered on the target, and lasts until the power expires. It subtracts 2 from her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Stealth]{Stealth} totals and negates 1 point of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03illumination00]{Illumination} penalties for those attacking the glowing character.

Shroud dims and slightly obscures the target so that attacks against her suffer a −1 penalty and she adds +1 to her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Stealth]{Stealth} rolls.

Heavy Weapon (+2).name: Heavy Weapon (+2)
Heavy Weapon (+2).text:
Glow/Shroud (+1)

The caster pours his energy into the attack, creating a focused blast. The attack counts as a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02heavyweaponh00]{Heavy Weapon (HW)}.

Lingering Damage (+2).name: Lingering Damage (+2)
Lingering Damage (+2).text:
Lingering Damage (+2)

The target is hit by fire, intense cold, acid, gnawing insects, or some other @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping} that continues to cause damage after the initial attack. On the victim’s next turn, he suffers the power’s base damage minus one die type (one additional turn only). If hit with a 2d6 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Bolt]{bolt}, for example, the victim takes 2d4 damage at the start of his next turn. If the base damage is already a d4 die type, it loses a die instead.

Range (+1 or +2).name: Range (+1 or +2)
Range (+1 or +2).text:
Range (+1/+2)

Double the power’s listed Range for 1 @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Point}, or triple it for +2. This modifier may not be used on powers with a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03touchattack000]{Touch} or the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor07gamema.JournalEntryPage.07gamemasterin00]{Cone Template}.

Selective (+1).name: Selective (+1)
Selective (+1).text:
Selective (+1)

With intense focus, the caster can choose not to affect any or all individual targets within a power’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{area of effect} (picking all enemies instead of allies in a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Blast]{blast}, for example).

Hinder or Hurry (+1).name: Hinder or Hurry (+1)
Hinder or Hurry (+1).text:
Hinder/Hurry (+1)

The target is slowed in some way, perhaps due to intense cold, a slippery surface, or even binding matter or energy. His base @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Pace} is reduced by 2 until the power expires.

A caster can Hurry the recipient instead. He might get increased energy, sure footing, or more powerful muscles. His @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Pace}  is increased by 2.

Effects of either modifier aren’t cumulative.

Bestiary.name: Bestiary
Bestiary.text:
Bestiary

Great heroes are often defined by the foes, monsters, and other horrors they face. In this chapter are a number of the most common threats across the many Savage Worlds.

Designing Threats

Nonplayer characters and monsters should have any @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Edges} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01hindrances0000]{Hindrances} the GM feels are appropriate. They are not created like player characters (though they should generally have the prerequisites of any Edges for completeness). Otherwise, give them the abilities you want them to have and spend your time and energy on the plot of the game or how best to entertain your group.

Bestiary Compendium

This section contains animals and monsters common to many Savage Settings. Note that for some creatures, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} is listed relative to the animal world, and is thus followed by an (A) to remind you that this is animal intelligence, not human intelligence, so don’t expect a dog to drive a car just because it’s a relatively smart animal.
